channel.title: Environment Variables
channel.description:
Hey there, long time reader, new time poster :D
I once created my own Moparscape private server a while ago, using "fr33sc4p3 pkz", but i have forgotten how to do it all! Well, I've been following a guide, and got stuck on the environment variables part, as the guides I have read have all outdated versions of Java. I have the latest version, and have got this far with the variables:
I've created a ClassPath in System Variables, and this is what's inside: [code]C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin;[/code] But, I know this is an old code, and I need to know what to change it to.
Also, I have created a PATH variable, and it contains this: [code]%SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%\System32\Wbem;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin;[/code] Again, that is the old code. I need to know which one to change it to.
I have none in User Variables yet. Also, as I am creating a new server, I am stuck with the compiler. Here is what is currently in it: [code]:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: :: :: :: This Compiler is under no licenses and may :: :: be distributed freely. :: :: :: ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit[/code]
Again, is there anything i need to change in there?
Thanks so much, and I appreciate all help.
------------------------------------------ Basically, my questions are: What is the code for the compiler, and what do I need to change the classpaths to.

item.title: Environment Variables
item.dc:creator: @krazy_karl krazy karl
item.description:
@krazy_karl wrote:

:S…
Is it a router?

item.title: Environment Variables
item.dc:creator: @phpMyTony phpMyTony
item.description:
@phpMyTony wrote:

Is what in my server files? The compile.bat? Yes, and that is what I have been editing.

EDIT: I think I know the problem. I have the JRE file, but not the JDK. Will post update in few minutes.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 19, 2009, 01:06:18 pm[/size][hr]Sorted now. Now I need to know how to do the port forwarding. The problem is that my step dad changed the user and pass on the router, and I doubt he’d tell me it. =[

Read full topic

item.title: Environment Variables
item.dc:creator: @krazy_karl krazy karl
item.description:
@krazy_karl wrote:

Is it in your server files?

Read full topic

item.title: Environment Variables
item.dc:creator: @krazy_karl krazy karl
item.description:
@krazy_karl wrote:

Just use the origonal code I gave you then.

@echo off COLOR 0b cls title Tanked-Up Compiler "%ProgramFiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause

Read full topic

item.title: Environment Variables
item.dc:creator: @phpMyTony phpMyTony
item.description:
@phpMyTony wrote:

Okay, so I done that. Thanks by the way.
But, on the compiler, when I press compile, it says “The system cannot find the path specified.”
I think this is because the compiler says: %ProgramFiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin[b]javac.exe[/b]
I find nothing to do with Javac.exe on my PC.
Ah, another thing: In the Java file in Program Files, in Program Files\Java, it only says: jre6

:S

Read full topic

item.title: Environment Variables
item.dc:creator: @krazy_karl krazy karl
item.description:
@krazy_karl wrote:

Just change the number for 13, lets see…
Your is currently C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin;
Try using…

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin;

As for the client,

@echo off COLOR 0b cls title Tanked-Up Compiler "%ProgramFiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause

Read full topic

item.title: Environment Variables
item.dc:creator: @phpMyTony phpMyTony
item.description:
@phpMyTony wrote:

Okay… But, you did not answer my question. Plus, that is for JDK Update 11 - I have update 13.

Read full topic

item.title: Environment Variables
item.dc:creator: @krazy_karl krazy karl
item.description:
@krazy_karl wrote:

This is my compiler…

@echo off COLOR 0b cls title Tanked-Up Compiler "%ProgramFiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause
Simple yet effective

Read full topic

item.title: Environment Variables
item.dc:creator: @phpMyTony phpMyTony
item.description:
@phpMyTony wrote:

Hey there, long time reader, new time poster

I once created my own Moparscape private server a while ago, using “fr33sc4p3 pkz”, but i have forgotten how to do it all!
Well, I’ve been following a guide, and got stuck on the environment variables part, as the guides I have read have all outdated versions of Java.
I have the latest version, and have got this far with the variables:

I’ve created a ClassPath in System Variables, and this is what’s inside:

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin;

But, I know this is an old code, and I need to know what to change it to.

Also, I have created a PATH variable, and it contains this:

%SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%\System32\Wbem;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin;

Again, that is the old code. I need to know which one to change it to.

I have none in User Variables yet. Also, as I am creating a new server, I am stuck with the compiler. Here is what is currently in it:

:: ::
:: This Compiler is under no licenses and may ::
:: be distributed freely. ::
:: ::
::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

@echo off
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit[/code]

Again, is there anything i need to change in there?

Thanks so much, and I appreciate all help.

Basically, my questions are: What is the code for the compiler, and what do I need to change the classpaths to.

Read full topic
